intro: Sopubia scaettae, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Sopubia scaettae has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. It is a perennial herb that is often found in coastal and mountainous areas of southern Italy.
